resources.string: No maps have been imported.\nUse the + button to import a map.
Use File Picker to select PDF maps that you downloaded. They will be copied into this app.
This will start up your browser and show a list of resources for downloading geospatial PDFs from the CPW website. Return to this app and use the Import Maps button above to load maps into this app.
Leaving this app and starting your browser. Once you download your map, please return to this app to load it.

Take this app out in the field to display your current location on PDFs from the HuntingAtlas, FishingAtlas, CPW Maps Library, or any geo-referenced PDF. No need for internet or data connection! Plus, access a list of resources for downloading PDF maps (requires data connection).

Click on the + button to import or download a map. When you have downloaded PDF maps, import them by clicking on the File Picker button. Use the menu in the top-left to select from Recent, Documents, or Downloads folders. Or select the Google Drive icon if the file is located there. Click on the PDF file and it will import it and display the map. The map file is copied to the app directory so deleting the original will not affect the map library.

To download a map, click on the + button then the Download Maps button. It will notify you that it is starting up your browser. It will load a page from the CPW website with resource to download geo-referenced PDFs.

In the Imported Maps list, click on a map. It will display the map in a new window. It will display you current lat, long at the top of the map. Your current location will be displayed on the map as a cyan circle outlined in white. Double tap or pinch to zoom. To add waypoints, click on the push pin at the top-right, then click on the map. If the waypoint label is showing, clicking on the map will hide it. Clicking on a waypoint will display it\'s label. Clicking on a waypoint label will let you edit the label and pushpin color.
